author: lundblad
msg: In FSFS, when recreating a fulltext, instead of combining all deltas, apply
one delta against a fulltext or the empty stream and combine the rest.
This avoids a lot of quadratic behaviour in the delta combiner, especially when
xdelta was used to create the stored deltas.  Since vdelta is still used
for deltas against the empty stream, the first delta will still trigger
the bad behaviour of the combiner without this change.  ghudson suggested
this way of avoiding the slowdown and reviewed.  Daniel Berlin
<dberlin@dberling.org> confirmed my timings.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_fs/fs_fs.c: Include assert.h.
(read_window): New.
(get_combined_window): Don't combine with the last window in the rep list.
Factor out the skipping and reading of a delta window to read_window.
(get_contents): Apply the last delta in the rep list directly to the source
plaintext or empty stream.  Allocate the buffers using apr_palloc instead of
apr_pcalloc.

author: xsteve
msg: Added user setting: svn-status-svn-environment-var-list
* trunk/contrib/client-side/psvn/psvn.el:
svn-status-svn-executable: New variable that specifies the name of the svn
executable
svn-status-svn-environment-var-list: New variable to specify some environment
variables that are specific to the svn process
(svn-run-svn): Use the two variables above

author: ghudson
msg: * HACKING: Clarify the 80-column line length restriction, to make it
clear that lines of exactly 80 columns are not kosher.

author: maxb
msg: Fix up some non-ideal style in the SWIG interface files.
This was pointed out by Kouhei Sutou's SWIG-Ruby bindings patch, but is in
fact a problem across all languages - just tickled a little more frequently by
the SWIG Ruby language module. We already had a couple of kludges in place in
core.i and svn_client.i for this problem, which I have now turned into the
uniform style throughout all eight modules.
Since I was modifying the #include stanzas anyway, I merged a tiny bit of the
Ruby patch whilst I was working on them.
* subversion/bindings/swig/NOTES: Document the issue.
* subversion/bindings/swig/core.i:
* subversion/bindings/swig/svn_client.i:
* subversion/bindings/swig/svn_delta.i:
* subversion/bindings/swig/svn_fs.i:
* subversion/bindings/swig/svn_ra.i:
* subversion/bindings/swig/svn_repos.i:
* subversion/bindings/swig/svn_types.i:
* subversion/bindings/swig/svn_wc.i:
Apply the newly documented guidelines to all eight files.

author: fitz
msg: Continue work on implementing the behaviors of the svn:needs-lock
property: When locking and unlocking a file, flip the perms on the
file if it has the svn:needs-lock property.
(This is essentially r12974, but implemented in libsvn_wc instead of
libsvn_client.)
* subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c (svn_wc_add_lock): If svn:needs-lock
is set on a path that was just locked, change the file to
read-write.
(svn_wc_remove_lock): If svn:needs-lock is set on a path that was
just unlocked, change the file to read-only.
